projects.name: SHVM.in
projects.summary: AI-first portfolio acting as a digital twin — this very system.
projects.problem: Traditional portfolios are static pages. This is an interactive engineering brain that hosts can query via MCP.
projects.architecture: Edge-native React application (TanStack Start on Cloudflare Workers) with retrieval-augmented generation. Embeds an MCP server so external hosts can programmatically query portfolio data.
projects.tradeoffs: Full-stack rendered at the edge — requires careful hydration and SSR management. AI context is deterministic, not hallucinated.
notable_decisions: Used TanStack Start over Next.js for tighter Cloudflare Workers integration
MCP server is self-contained within the same deployment
Static JSON data layer for deterministic tool outputs

projects.name: shvm-db
projects.summary: DynamoDB-compatible database built entirely on Cloudflare Durable Objects.
projects.problem: Edge-native strongly consistent storage without traditional database infrastructure.
projects.architecture: Partitioned data using Durable Object instances, each running local SQLite. Deterministic key routing via consistent hashing. Append-only versioned storage with Leader-Replica topology for read scaling.
projects.tradeoffs: Strong consistency over global availability. Limited cross-partition queries. Tied to Cloudflare infrastructure.
notable_decisions: Append-only storage — no hard deletes, all data versioned
Leader-Replica pattern for read scaling with strong consistency
Client-side routing with cached metadata to bypass PartitionDO in data path
DynamoDB-compatible API for ecosystem compatibility
YCSB benchmarking built into the project

projects.name: Liva
projects.summary: Real-time collaborative whiteboard and note-taking app.
projects.problem: Serverless real-time collaboration without dedicated WebSocket servers.
projects.architecture: Each board is a Durable Object acting as a mini-server for state and broadcast. WebSocket connections managed per-DO. Puppeteer-based screenshot generation uploaded to R2.
projects.tradeoffs: State held in memory but persisted to DO storage. Infrastructure-specific to Cloudflare.
notable_decisions: Durable Object per board — isolates state and simplifies broadcast
Extracted excalidraw-live-sync as standalone open-source library
Monorail recording library for DOM/Canvas interactions
System Shots feature: automated screenshot generation via Puppeteer + R2

projects.name: Backflare
projects.problem: Secure, user-owned data backup at the edge without trusting cloud providers with plaintext.
projects.architecture: Uses Durable Objects for coordination and R2 for encrypted storage. Client-side encryption ensures privacy.
projects.tradeoffs: Client-side encryption adds complexity. Recovery depends on user key management.
notable_decisions: End-to-end encryption — server never sees plaintext
R2 for cost-effective large object storage

projects.name: Din
projects.summary: Offline-first PWA note-taking app with AI.
projects.problem: Reliable offline notes with AI capabilities on unstable connections.
projects.architecture: Local-first with Dexie (IndexedDB), sync via tRPC to Workers, edge AI inference.
projects.tradeoffs: Complexity of sync conflict resolution. Offline-first adds state management overhead.
notable_decisions: Local-first architecture — works fully offline
tRPC for type-safe client-server communication
Edge AI inference for low-latency AI features

projects.name: Krishna
projects.problem: Managing complex shift-based subscriptions for physical seats.
projects.architecture: Shift and subscription model, AI-powered analytics chatbot instead of dashboards.
projects.tradeoffs: Strict shift rules reduce flexibility but ensure integrity.
notable_decisions: AI chatbot replaces traditional analytics dashboards
Strict shift-based rules for booking integrity

projects.name: Ludo-Elm
projects.problem: State consistency in distributed multiplayer games.
projects.architecture: Functional core with Elm, ensuring zero runtime exceptions. WebSocket-based real-time sync.
projects.tradeoffs: Elm's ecosystem is smaller but guarantees no runtime exceptions.
notable_decisions: Chose Elm for its guarantee of zero runtime exceptions
Functional architecture for predictable state management

open_source.name: excalidraw-live-sync
open_source.summary: Standalone library for Excalidraw live sync extracted from Liva.
